DOC.brief_title: Intensive Home-based Treadmill Training Walking Attainment Young Children With Cerebral Palsy
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study determine optimal parameter dose home-based treadmill train compare high-intensity ( 5 days/week , twice daily 10-20 min 6 week ) low-intensity ( 2 days/week , daily 10-20 minute 6 week ) treadmill train ; compare effect high- versus low-intensity treadmill train walk attainment overall walking activity young child cerebral palsy . Hypotheses - A intensive protocol treadmill train increase walk onset young child CP . - A intensive protocol treadmill train increase overall walking activity young child CP . Specific Aims - To determine optimal parameter dose home-based treadmill train compare high-intensity low-intensity home-based treadmill training . - To compare effect high- versus low-intensity treadmill train walk onset overall walking activity . Study design •Prospective randomize control trial Study population •Two group 12 child CP age 3 year walk yet receive either home-based high-intensity treadmill train low-intensity treadmill training . The child assess , immediately , 1-month 4-months follow intervention via standardized outcome measure .
DOC.criteria: Signs walk readiness demonstrate ability sit 30 second place take 5 7 step support trunk arm . Because young child often formally diagnose CP 2 year age , include child show bilateral impairment ( i.e . diplegia quadriplegia , hemiplegia ) demonstrate upper motor neuron sign ( i.e . spasticity and/or hyperreflexia ) identify highrisk motor disability physician history uncontrolled seizure diagnosis genetic disorder cardiac orthopedic contraindication stand walk orthopedic surgery past 6 month use spasticityreducing medication Botox injection past 6 month
